snippet: Russia’s Pavel Kulizhnikov became the first speedskater to break 34 seconds for 500 meters, setting a world record of 33.98 seconds to win the event at a World Cup meet in Salt Lake City.
abstract: Russian speedskater Pavel Kulizhnikov becomes first to break 34 seconds for 500 meters, winning World Cup meet in Salt Lake City with world record of 33.98 seconds.
lead_paragraph: Russia’s Pavel Kulizhnikov became the first speedskater to break 34 seconds for 500 meters, setting a world record of 33.98 seconds to win the event at a World Cup meet in Salt Lake City.
